headline: Classic Key Lime Pie
description: Creamy, sweet, and tart, this classic lime dessert is always a favorite.
name: Classic Key Lime Pie
recipeIngredient: 2 (14 ounce) cans EAGLE BRAND® Sweetened Condensed Milk

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Combine graham cracker crumbs and sugar. Add melted butter and stir until evenly moistened. Press mixture into bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie plate to form crust. Bake 10 minutes or until crust begins to brown. Cool 15 minutes on wire rack.

Whisk sweetened condensed milk, lime juice and sour cream in large bowl until blended. Stir in lime peel. Pour filling into crust. Bake 7 to 10 minutes or until tiny bubbles begin to form on surface of pie. Cool completely on wire rack.

Beat cream, powdered sugar and vanilla in large mixing bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until stiff. Top pie with whipped cream. Chill at least 1 hour before serving. Best served the same day.

review.reviewBody: I just made it. I have a question though after reading reviews. Nothing in recipe says anything about eggs but reviews do. Did I miss something and should I serve this to my guest?
Great recipe . Added raspberries to the top. Tasty and delicious
I followed the recipe given. It tasted like sour cream, and did not set up. Unable to eat.
Good recipe. I added a tad more lime juice and zest otherwise it was tasting like condensed milk I also cooked it for about 15 minutes and it came out perfect :)

My first time making key lime pie. I purchased key lines - zesting was easy, I got a ridiculously small amount of juice, though??. I made a few adjustments to the recipe: I increased the lime juice to 1 cup, and increased lime zest to 1-1/2 TBS. it just wasn’t tart enough. I also increased the baking time to 30 minutes. Perfect!!
Perfect! The whole family loved it. I didn't change a thing. (I used actual key limes).

This is my second time making it (used the food processor only this time). I prefer taking the time to mix and whip by hand, tho': it's almost as fast and not nearly as much to clean up.

Have I mentioned how tasty this is? Not too tart and the sweetness is just right. 

And boy, it's fast and easy. It's as good as I've ever had from a local restaurant or grocer, and best of all, I can have some whenever I want some!
I made this for a thank you to a man who's favorite pie is key lime l am not a fan his family has been. Racing about it ever since
Yum!!!! So creamy and tasteful!

It was perfectly balanced between sweet and tangy with a good lime flavor. Nice and creamy, husband and guests raved. Had leftovers tonight without whipped cream and it was still wonderful. I left out the zest (because I forgot it). Only issue was that I slightly overbaked the crust so it was hard to cut.
I absolutely loved this recipe! I cooked it for 15 minutes and was perfection!
The only change I made was cooking time. This pie was a huge hit with my coworkers. I’ll definitely be making more of them.
Been using this recipe for years and the whole family loves it. Very easy and delicious!
Easy AND fantastic
Several people for whom I made this pie told me it was the best they've ever had. Super easy recipe. I did bake it longer than recommended--maybe 15 minutes total.
I did have to cook it for 30 mins perfect recipe if you don’t want to use eggs. I used a gender snap crust
it was delicious! i had to bake it for thirty minutes, and put a little more lime (but that was probably for me personally) but it was delicious!!!! 10/10 would recommend.
This was not good. It took me 45 minutes to bake once it was semi-firm I cool it down and cut the “pie”. Turns out it tasted like sweet cream and lime.
Wonderful! Will definitely make again. Easy directions and tasted great
Easy to follow recipe. Sweet yet a little tart, smooth. I loved this recipe.
needs 30 min

I make this all the time for my family, friends and coworkers. I put mine in 4 oz. mason jars and I put them in the freezer after I bake them. A great way to grab and go to put in your lunch or take on picnics. Also great for parties too. When I use this recipe I add 1/3 cup more lime juice. I also hand squeeze my limes and I also leave the pulp in mine. WOW what an amazing flavor. I love the fact its four ingredients and that's it. So easy and simple. My husband says, there is no Key Lime Pie out there that can compare to mine. :)

This turned out great! Only issue was having enough time f the key limes to get the 2/3 cup of juice. Even using a zesting tool it was tough to get 2 teaspoons. The rest of the recipe was so say & it tasted heavenly with nice consistency. I would make it again.
Delicious!!! I will definitely make this pie again. I also made a raspberry sauce to drizzle over top it... Even better!

This was an amazing pie and I will definitely make it again. I read the reviews first so I cooked the pie for thirty minutes rather then ten and I added crushed pecans to the crust. I will do the same next time.

I've been baking this pie for years. Never had added sour cream, but my recipe did call for egg. I tried this recipe with the sour cream and it was delicious. I used the bottled key lime juice because the store limes are about the size of cherries.
It works very well with the bottled juice. By the way, the 8-10 minute bake time is correct. It does not have to be bubbling on top. It will gel up very well when refrigerated. As one baker stated, she placed left-over filling in the frig, unbaked, and it
was perfect. I believe the 10 min. baking time was because of the raw egg in my recipe. Also please purchase a zester. My best cooking implement.
Fabulous! Very tasty! A real treat! Very easy to make!
This recipe is so easy and delicious!
Love this recipe. Not too tart or too sweet. It was easy to make and had a fluffy texture.
made two of these for a party and they were a hit. I found fresh Key Limes and squoze my own juice. Will make this many more times !
I had to cook it for 30 minutes but overall it was great! My family liked it :)
Delicious and easy!
So delicious! It won a pie contest.
My daughter loved it but it won’t cook in 10 minutes. I cooked it 20-30 minutes.

This was quick, which made me very happy. My daughter loved it and that's what matters to me.
Thank you so much for sharing your recipe.

This is our new favorite recipe for Key lime pie! It was so light and fluffy to the tongue. My husband and I both loved it out small pieces. Desserts are a treat to be savored over time, and not necessarily shared. Saying that, I can't wait to serve this to special friends. I did follow the recipe exactly, except I used a gluten free graham cracker crust since I am celiac. I also used the whip cream on top of each cut piece rather than on top of the whole pie. I think the pie will last a bit longer, since only the two of us will be eating it. I have a whipper too, so the whipped cream stays fresh over several weeks.

I'm sure the quality of this is based on the quality of the key limes that are used, but I bought what I thought would be great fresh little key limes. Just really not a good flavor nor strong enough lime flavor and I'm not willing to try again, even though it could have well have been the limes I used.
Baked a lot longer (20 min). So good!
This was a huge hit with the family. I did omit the topping and served the pie with cool whip on the side.

Loved it. I used a purchased crust and whipped topping, but the filling was the most creamy I've ever tasted. I used an extra 1/4 cup of lime juice because the taste wasn't strong enough and I like the sour to offset the sweet. Will definitely make this again!

Followed as written except added more lime zest, just because I had extra. And added lime zest to the whipped cream mixture . Also took advice from other reviews and cooked for 30 min. Husband LOVED it!! Will make again and again!! Oh and I bought the crust;)
Super simple and so good! I used a little extra lime just just because as I juiced the limes that’s how it worked out. This one is definitely a go to for a simple desserts.
Excellent summer desert
Made this for 4th of July pool party. Guest said it was the best Key Lime pie they ever had.
Did not change a darn thing...no need. Really, really good! I made three over the weekend. I wanted to have a couple in the freezer.
Delicious from the bottom to the top! Easy as well, company worthy for sure.

This is quick and easy. Mine did need to bake a bit longer than the suggested time....about 15 minutes before I saw little holes on the top, but I think I could have taken it out sooner. I used a pre-made crust. Remember, if you use a pre-made graham cracker crust, you have to set it on a baking sheet, or you won't get good results.
Followed recipe and really delicious. Next time I will cut down the sugar in the crust somewhat as it was very sweet. I will also increase the lime juice somewhat for more flavor.

Congratulations! Your days of searching for the perfect key lime pie recipe are finally over. I made this for my husband for Valentine's Day and it was absolutely DIVINE! Being from Florida, I know my key lime pies and this is by far the best one I have ever tasted. The fresh lime makes all the difference. This will be going into my pie repertoire for forever. This recipe is truly a gift and super duper easy to make, too. Make it! You'll be so glad you did.

WOW.. This recipe is perfect. So easy to make. When you take your first bite, you're doing the happy dance. 

When it came to the baking time for the whole pie itself, I'm not sure if the time in the instruction is correct. It said 7-10 to minutes, or when you see tiny bubbles. The pie was in the oven for about a 1/2 hour until I saw the tiny bubbles.
So keep in mind, the pie might be baking longer depending on your oven.
Too sweet for me. If I make it again I'll use less sugar
This amazing!!! But I use key limes only. Never tried it with regular limes. Definitely a keeper recipe as it is now a family favorite.
Turned out PERFECT and was a hit at last night's dinner party. WILL make again.
Love this recipe...and even more my mom loved it for her birthday desert. It's a keeper!
can't go wrong with this one. perfect as is
Excellent. Use fresh key limes. Bake for at least 30 minutes
#YUMMMMM
This pie was spot on. I have just returned from Key West and was looking for a piece of pie that had this level of tart and sweet. This recipe was absolutely perfect!! Truly a classic.
Made this recipe for a 90th bday party.....20 people LOVED it!!

I LOVE this recipe!! It tastes very citrusy and has a wonderful texture!! One thing that I do to add a slight bit more lime flavor though is add extra key lime juice and zest into the whipped cream. I've done this every time that I have made it and it works beautifully!!
Delicious! Limey! The perfect blend of sweet and tart! And EASY! I let it cook for at LEAST a half hour. It was a little looser than I would have liked.
Best and fastest Key Lime Pie after a filling meal.
The flavor was good but the texture was heavy...more like a cheesecake. I also had to increase the cooking time to 30 minutes. Probably will not make this again.
This is a great pie! I left off the whipped cream- and everyone loved it!
This was very easy to make and also very quick. Definitely make the homemade pie crust it is worth it! I should have made two of them because it was gone in minutes.

This recipe is very easy to follow and quick to prepare. I have had requests from the American Legion twice!! The filling is yummy good...not too sweet as some key lime pies are. Fresh whip cream can be as think as you like on top and I sprinkle more lime zest. This is my go to recipe for key lime pie!!

I made one slight change to this recipe, I added almonds to the crust. Other than that I followed it completely and it was fantastic! Using key limes though they're tedious to juice makes all the difference in the taste. I also sprinkled a bit of zest on top of the fresh whipped cream. Looking forward to making this again....our next family dinner
Excellent and easy to make!

This was the first time I had made, or even tasted, a key lime pie. It was wonderful; too rich to eat every day, but had great flavor. Rather than trying to squeeze out 2/3 cup of juice out of those tiny key limes, I bought a bottle of the 100% key lime juice and I also used a Keebler graham cracker crust. Those two shortcuts made preparation a breeze without sacrificing flavor or quality.
Most popular pie at thanksgiving! Followed recipe instructions exactly. Everyone loved it. Perfect consistency.
I baked it from 15 minutes. I will definitely make this again; everyone liked it!
This is my first attempt at key lime pie and it was a success! I wouldn't change anything about this recipe! I just need to make 2 nxt time!!
The homeless shelter residents that I cook for said that this is the BEST key lime pie they have ever had!
Made this key lime pie twice and always delicious. No changes to the recipe.
We don't like things overly sweet so we added 2 Tablespoons of lime zest instead of just 2 tsp. Also added lime zest to the whipped cream, then put more on top. Delicious.
~Must bake for 30 minutes~ SHORT CUTS... I used a store bought graham crust and for the top I used Extra Creamy Cool Whip with the vanilla and powder sugar folded in.

WOW, this pie is RICH! I made it for Memorial Day, and we loved it. I'd suggest using a deep-dish pie pan for it. Also, if you're making the crust, use about 1 1/2 packages (there are 3 to each box!) of graham crackers and crumble them in a food processor.

Addendum to the above comment:

My wife suggested that we lower the amount of sour cream just a little bit, and it worked wonders! It's not AS rich, and the short baking time worked just fine.

I tried this recipe for something light for summer my family LOVED it. My husband said it tasted better than anything he ever tasted. I then tried this with both lemons and oranges they were both VERY GOOD. This recipe is easy and the taste is a loop good with all three fruits.
Outstanding recipe. It was just the perfect amount of tartness and sweetness. I will definitely make it again.

I have always enjoyed key lime pie, but have never made one of my own. I always thought they would be difficult to make, but I was wrong! I quickly found this recipe and made it exactly as it was written except I used non-fat condensed milk and low fat sour cream. This pie was OUTSTANDING! It was so easy to make and turned out fabulous! So creamy and sweet, but tart. Everyone in the family, kids included, loved it!! It is definitely something I'll make again!
It took more like 30 mins! Tasty pie for sure!

This was an outstanding recipe! Aside from baking the filling for 20 minutes, I stuck to the directions. I doubled the topping and it turned out just as amazing as the rest of the pie. Thanks for sharing!
The only change that I made to this was adding 2 egg yolks, and one full egg! Turned out so much better!

Made this pie instead of a traditional birthday cake and received rave reviews from guests. Key lime is hard to find so when you do, you can squeeze out juice and freeze until next use. Great recipe. Thank you.
Wonderful recipe. Fabulous pie. I added the pulp as well that came out while grating the peel. What a yummy kick!
Easy and Delicious!
Got the key lime fever after a trip to Florida. Not a big pie eater until after our trip and this recipe.

It was great! It was my first attempt at key lime pie and I am going to make it again very soon. The only change is that I had to bake the pie longer in the oven to get it more cooked for the slightly bubbly top. About 8-10 londer than the recipe states.

I needed an egg-free recipe for this bc of my g'daughter's allergies to eggs. I then added 2 more TBS of lime juice and saved time by filling indiv. graham tart shells. I cooked 20 mins waiting for the 'bubbles' to appear but didn't. So when I saw the edges cooking, I took them out of oven. I filled a shallow container with leftover filling, and wouldn't you know, it was a great, creamy consistency w/o any cooking! Next time I will just fill and chill overnight and NO cooking. It's summer, no need to bake bc it doesn't use eggs.
It's a nice creamy pie and easy enough to make. I cooked for 30 min as another reviewer suggested and that was perfect. For my taste it there just wasn't enough lime kick.

i wanted a simple key lime pie recipe to make quickly and saw this one. the pie had to bake for 30 minutes and really tasted like sweetened condensed milk. it also didn't hava a good lime flavor, there just wasn't enough. this pie was okay, but not anything i would make for a party

My First time making a pie at all. Easy to follow instructions, and no intimidating ingredients. Nice sweet and tart balance. Next time, I'll get a zester, was a bit much to zest with my serrated knife!

I tried a slight variation of this recipe and found that they worked really well as cupcakes, the batter was plenty stiff to hold up to the smaller individual serving size but I did think the flavor was a little lacking on the signature key lime tartness

.
Once you put the custard in the pie shell you better cook for 30 minutes. Will not be set in 10 minutes. Been making this for 42 years.

The BEST key lime pie recipe! I've never made it before - made it for my dad's birthday. The entire family loved it. Held it's form very well. Whipped cream was also the perfect amount of sweetness and cream! Love love love. Will never use another recipe again for key lime!

my whole family loved this! i cheated because i used already-made graham crusts that were given to me by someone who bought them by accident, so i was trying to think of something to use with them. this fit the bill perfectly! since i love pecans, i chopped some and sprinkled them on the crust before browning in the oven. i was skeptical about the whipping cream on top, but it was delicious and i look forward to making this again! if i ever make the crust from scratch, i will add pecans throughout the mixture. a local restaurant here does that with their key lime pie and it's great. it gives the crust more substance.

This was my first attempt at key lime pie, and it was a hit with my husband. I rate this recipe 5 stars! On the topping, I used more powdered sugar than the 1/4 cup, enough to get the consistency I wanted. Also, I used fresh key lime juice, which I think made it perfect.
I used 1/2 cup key lime juice and liked the sweet-tart balance better.

I used fresh key limes because I have a tree in my yard, and I wanted to find the perfect recipe! This was it! Several extended family members commented that this was the best key lime pie they have ever tasted! I followed the recipe exactly as directed. Awesome!
